qas.question: For which masterpiece did Cesare Beccaria become famous?
Into how many languages was Cesare Beccaria's Crimes and Punishments (1764) translated?
Which work established Francesco Mario Pagano as an international authority on criminal law?

answers.text: Considerazioni sul processo criminale (Considerations on the criminal trial, 1787)

qas.question: In what year did Francesco Mario Pagano publish Saggi Politici?

context: Cesare Beccaria, a jurist and one of the great Enlightenment writers, became famous for his masterpiece Of <a0_0>Crimes and Punishments (1764)<a0_0/>, which was later translated into <a1_0>22<a1_0/> languages. Another prominent intellectual was Francesco Mario Pagano, who wrote important studies such as Saggi Politici (Political Essays, <a3_0>1783<a3_0/>), one of the major works of the Enlightenment in Naples, and <a2_0>Considerazioni sul processo criminale (Considerations on the criminal trial, 1787)<a2_0/>, which established him as an international authority on criminal law.
